title: #4521 Herringbone Street
body:
Thud Thud

The closet door has been going like that for a good minute or so now. It might be the rats inside the wall but this situation has got me nervous since I noticed the weird couple who followed ever since I left the apartment.

I've been grieving the death of my brother for a while now. He went missing on a cruise last month, and they never found any traces of the ship anywhere, and as much as I hope that he's alive out there somewhere, I just braced myself for the harsh truth and accepted it.

Not to mention the news of a serial killer's murder spree spreading terror in the whole city, the latest news being a 20 year old woman going missing after a night out in the bar.

I've been hiding in this rusty old house for an hour now, unsure if it's safe already to go outside.

Thud Thud Thud

I would appreciate it if these thuds would just stop before that couple gets in here.

I hazard a look out the broken window, checking each side of the street. Nothing. I guess it would be safe to go now.

I was about to pull my head back when I notice a movement from the end of the street. A vehicle. Although it's hard to make out its appearance under the dark night sky, something in my gut knew that it was that dark gray sedan that the couple was driving.

Okay, calm down. I tell myself. I can get out of this situation without actually getting hurt.

Then suddenly, I hear footsteps outside the room.

Footsteps?, I thought. In this abandoned house? Impossible. I walk quietly to the door and put my ear against it.

Those are indeed footsteps, and whispers. Is there some kind of a spirit in this house?

Thud Thud

Everything's falling apart. I start having second thoughts about this plan working.

Suddenly, the sound of a vehicle stopping and car doors opening from outside caught my attention.

There's no way that they know I'm here. I look out the window and see the couple from earlier get out of the car and shine their flashlights into the house. I quickly duck to avoid getting spotted.

Once the lights have passed the room's windows, I take a peek again.

"--think they're in there. " the woman says.

"You sure?" her male companion replies. There's something authoritative in their tones.

"I did see some movement in the ground floor of the house." the woman says.

"A'ight. Let's go in and check." he says to his companion, taking something out from his side.

I take a deep breath upon realizing what he was holding. A gun.

His companion does the same. They both walk towards the house until they were out of my sight. Seconds later, I hear the front door creaking open.

"Freeze!" the man shouts.

Huh? Is there someone else in here?

A deep husky voice then says, "Damned demons plague my head fuck off pigs"

"Get out of here you damn hobo junkie fuck." the woman says.

I have to make this quick. I peek out the window and see the junkie running away.

Good. They might leave now.

"Fucking hell, Ortega. Just a damn junkie." the man says.

"Well, Henry, I didn't know that it was just gonna be a false alarm." Ortega replies.

"Let's just get out of here and canvass the rest of the neighborhood, there are some still occupied houses here anyway." Henry says.

THUD THUD THUD

"What the fuck?" Henry says.

"Upstairs." Ortega replies.

Luckily, the walls have deteriorated to the point where every noise can be heard from all corners of the house. Unfortunately, they also heard the thuds from the closet.

I hide behind the door so as soon as they open it, I could get out of this situation quick and without any hassles.

Each step they take can be heard by the floor squeaking, no matter how carefully or slowly they tread the old house's floors.

They're right outside the room now. I hear the doorknob turning and take a deep breath.

Screech

The beam from their flashlights suddenly illuminate the room as the thuds grow more consistent when finally: "HELP!" a woman's voice echoes throughout the house, coming from the closet itself.

This gave me the perfect opportunity to finally take my blade out and stab the male detective in the side and in the neck. His partner was taken aback when I pushed the man's still gurgling body into her, crashing onto the floor and sending her gun scuttling away to the other side of the room.

She struggled to push the big man on top of her but this gave me the time I needed to knock her out with the hilt of the knife.

Fortunately, the closet remained unopened during the commotion or the lady inside would've been screaming her lungs out.

As I make my way to the closet, the man grabs my ankle on a futile attempt to stop me. I smile down at him and kick him in the face, knocking him out.

I open the closet door and meet the woman's wide eyed gaze at me. I cover her mouth before she was able to scream and whisper, "You just made this harder on yourself."

The whole closet smelled like piss and shit. It's not uncommon for me though, it's a common risk in this type of situation. What I like is the smell of fear from every victim, making sure that they know that they'll soon receive their punishments for their crimes.

I knock her out and drag her out the closet, down the stairs, out the house, and stuff her in the detective's car trunk. There's gonna be a lot of work to be done tomorrow.

I proceed to get back in the house and drag the female detective outside and stuff her in the trunk after tying her up.

I smile as I think of the new headlines tomorrow.

Detective killed by serial killer, partner missing. Missing woman found dead Serial Killer strikes again
author: AugustPetrarch
